body.name: EZDIY-FAB PCIe 4.0 GPU Mount Bracket, Multi-Angle Adjustment with All White Riser Cable, Compatible to RTX4090, 4080, 4070ti - White
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 15 hrs 19 mins
features: Enhance Cooling Efficiency: Adjustable bracket allows mounting of GPU vertically or at an angle for better heat dissipation on PSU shroud or any metal plane
Strong Magnet Base: Equipped with a magnet for stable placement on PSU shroud
Wide Compatibility: Supports most 2 and 3 slot graphics cards, and made of high-quality metal material for increased structural toughness

Compatible with Latest Models: Features Gen4 riser cable and compatible with RTX 4090, RTX 4080, RTX 4070ti, RTX 30' Series, and RX70' Series. Prior testing of riser cable onto GPU is recommended. Please refer to length spec image to confirm compatibility with your chassis.
Please test the riser cable onto the GPU first before installing the GPU to vertical bracket mount./ Please refer to length spec image and confirm that there is enough space of your chassis.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works like a charm
reviews.reviewText: Fits well in my rosewill cullinan v500 case. The case has some mounting plates in the way, but it works well, just back it up a bit and open one slot cover for the cable. The magnets are strong and easily stabilize a 3070. Not a huge fan of the pci cable as it's a little stiff but it will do fine. The pins pushing through the cloth backing as seen in other reviews, aren't a bin deal on the mount they will never contact or disrupt performance, for 60$ a mount and cable that seems to perform the task of transferring 4.0x16 speeds, its to be expected. Its Nothing to crazy like C_Payne PCIe adapters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars If you have a HYTE Y60 and a large 40 series GPU you need this
reviews.reviewText: I have a 4090 and Y60 case. both are beautiful but not a good fit in the case at least in stock form. Technically the Y60 was designed for water cooling. The problem is that the stock mount is too close to the glass so with the size of the 4090, it sits too close to the glass and can’t get proper airflow. I was consistently getting 80-85c temps in modern games with fans on full blast. Wasn’t until I took the glass off to realize what the problem was and ran ~20 degrees cooler. But I don’t like having the glass off my case bc I have a sheddy dog and it gets dusty.I saw this mount recommended on some forums so gave it a try. Solved all my problems! Temps were way down vs stock mount and sits far enough back off the glass. Plus it can sit freely in the case without needing to bolt it in so you can move it around freely in the case and can also tilt it a bit for even better airflow. Super easy to install and sits firm on the bottom of my case with magnets.Only downsides are I think it is overly expensive for what it is. Also the magnets are glued on and just moving it around the case to adjust caused the top layer to start peeling off the feet. It still works fine and stays in place plus you can’t see it so not a big deal but just an annoyance esp for the price.Overall I will say if you have the Y60 case and a bigger card then you need this or a similar mount if you want normal temps. Otherwise I would make sure to take the glass off while gaming. Nice case looks beautiful but it certainly is not perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds my EVGA 3080 FTW3 with no problem.
reviews.reviewText: This is a really great mount! Just moving my GPU into this and setting it at a 45 degree angle cooled my card by 10c. Setting it at a 45 degree angle makes it easier for your fans to cool the card. The magnetic feet are a cool feature, it makes it easy to position exactly and then it doesn't move easily. But you need to make sure it will fit in your case. If you have a mid tower case, this probably will have a tough time fitting. I have a full tower and it works great! The included card rise cable seems to be pretty well built, and with these types of mounts, the rise cable is usually the weak link.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best creation for mounting beefy GPU
reviews.reviewText: Nothing about dislike. Used this to mount my GPU. The original spot for my GPU was way too close to the front panel. So I had to remove it in order to play games. My pc is next to me so it gets really hot. After installing this, I was able to freely move my GPU because it’s being held down my magnets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Weak riser cable - pins pushed through the back immediately.
reviews.reviewText: The bracket itself is very nice and sturdy, the riser cable is a180 from this. Pins pushed through immediately, no signal to PC. Quite the disappointment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good bracket, cable issues.
reviews.reviewText: Picked this up to help give my 4090 some breathing room in my Hyte Y60. Seemed fine until actually trying to run anything GPU intensive, where it would crash consistently.I’d been having no problems using Hyte’s included riser cable, so I wound up just taking that and hooking it up instead of the one included with this bracket. The bracket itself is sturdy enough to hold the card in place on its own, so just snapping the Hyte riser cable onto the card worked fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Did not fit.
reviews.reviewText: It’s a cool idea, but the placement of the HDMI connection is bad. For reference my case is a Hyte Y60.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well for its purpose
reviews.reviewText: Currently using a 4070ti in a Hyte Y60 case, I love how the bottom is magnetic to help it stick to the bottom of the case, would recommend it if you're looking for a tilt bracket.
